utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Would you pass the mustard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure. Hey, want to hear a fun fact about mustard?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is it that the glucosinolates which give mustard its flavour were evolved by the cabbage family as a chemical defence against caterpillars?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, that was fun. Good for you, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Raj (entering with Howard)
utterance.content: Hey, there.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, you’re early. The movie doesn’t start for an hour.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Actually, we’re not going to the movies. We are here to kidnap you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, you eloped and we didn’t get a chance to throw you a bachelor party, so there’s a van downstairs and we’re here to take you to a surprise location for the weekend.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’d hardly call this kidnapping. Where’s the blindfold? Where’s the duct tape? Where’s the part where you call me and demand ransom and I try to keep you on the phone, but you hang up seconds before I can trace it and then I say I’m getting too old for this crud?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: When do we leave?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Right now.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, Penny packed you a bag.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wow, okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re seriously going to get in a van and let these two take you to an unknown destination for an entire weekend?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, not just him, you’re coming, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, and how do you think you’re going to get me to do that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Unhand me. This is ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I told you to put tape on his mouth.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And I told you he bit me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s bad enough I’m being taken against my will. I don’t see why it has to be in some hippie’s mobile sex dungeon.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, Sheldon, there’s something about this van that you’re going to find very interesting.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It runs on syphilis?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: This van was owned and driven by your personal physics hero, Richard Feynman.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. A buddy of mine let me borrow it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This was Feynman’s van? That’s so cool.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, nothing’s been changed since he drove it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I bet he picked up a lot of cute grad students in this bad boy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, and talked about physics with them.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, are you gonna give us a clue where we’re headed?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, okay, let’s see. They’ve got spicy food and there’s a chance you’ll get diarrhoea.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: India.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We can drive there.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Your house?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We are going to Me-hi-co.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fun, I’ve never been there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, don’t be fooled. I’m from Texas, Me-hi-co is Spanish for Mexico.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What’s wrong with Mexico?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, mariachi bands, wild dogs, beans that jump around ’cause there’s a worm inside.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, calm down. There’s a theme to this weekend. We are going to Mexico in Feynman’s van to stay at the vacation house Feynman bought with the money from his Nobel Prize.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Viva la Imodium. Ay-ay-ay.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Come on, Leonard’s doing bachelor stuff. You sure we can’t take you to a strip club?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Nah, if I want to see a naked dancing man, I just flush the toilet while Leonard’s in the shower.

utterance.speaker: Amy (entering)
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I know we’re not making a fuss, but in the spirit of bachelorette parties, I made cookies in the shape of male genitals.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You really didn’t have to, whoa! That is anatomic.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Thank you. The veins are gummy worms.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, look, Jewish and gentile.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I had extra dough.

utterance.speaker: Penny (reading text)
utterance.content: Oh, that’s Leonard. He said they’re about to cross the border.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I hope the boys don’t get too crazy in Mexico.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, right. Lock up your daughters or Sheldon might lecture them about the North American Free Trade Agreement.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Boy, that was a long night for me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh-oh. According to this Mexican customs website, visitors may not bring more than five laser discs, 20 compact discs or 12 VHS tapes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We don’t have any of those.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How can you be sure? VHS was king when Feynman drove this van. For all we know, there are hidden compartments lousy with Jane Fonda workout videos.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If there was a hidden compartment, don’t you think you’d be stuffed in it by now?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are we all up to date on our yellow fever inoculations?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You don’t need a yellow fever shot to go to Mexico.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You can never be too careful. I got one last year before I went to Epcot.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So, Penny, how’s married life?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, it’s good. I just wish Leonard would work up the courage to tell Sheldon he’s moving in here.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You guys still aren’t living together?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We are. I mean, he sleeps here. But it’s only a matter of time before Sheldon has a bad dream and tries to climb into bed with the Leonard-shaped pile of pillows.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Speaking of Sheldon, how’s single life treating you?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Fine, I guess. I’ve been focusing on me. I was thinking about changing my wardrobe.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Good for you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: But then I decided I don’t want to go changing who I am just because of some man.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Good for you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, it is normal to want to change your look after a breakup.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Actually, I was thinking of making one small change.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Your sweater?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Your glasses?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Your hair?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Your shoes.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Piercing my ears.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You really never had that done?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: My mom said pierced ears were for whores, pirates and genies.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, well, you’re a grown woman now.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I know, but Sheldon had this clause in the Relationship Agreement forbidding cosmetic surgery unless it’s to look like a Klingon.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We’ll take you to the mall to get it done.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why? I can do it right here.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Really? You have a piercing gun?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. All you need is a needle and an ice cube. I’ve done it, like, a dozen times.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, come on. I’ll be gentle. Let me take your ear virginity.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: This party’s weird.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, watch your speed. I hear the Mexican police target tourists.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, not a problem. If anything goes down, we just put Koothrappali in the driver’s seat and slap a sombrero on his head.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dude, how many races can you offend in a single breath?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know. Have you watched the Olympics with me?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, can you believe that we’re driving in a van that was owned by one of the greatest scientific minds of the 20th century? It’s like the Batmobile. If Batman was real and a physicist and his car wasn’t cool.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It is extraordinary.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Perhaps some of his mojo will rub off on us. Maybe between this and his beach house, we will be inspired to greatness.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I usually don’t put too much stock in charms and talismans. However, even I must admit feeling Richard Feynman’s butt dent cupping my own bottom that does get the creative juices flowing.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, I have to return this van. Keep your creative juices in your pants.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What was that?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I think it’s a tyre.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What if it’s banditos shooting at us? What if we get kidnapped? What if we end up in a factory making Bart Simpson piñatas for the rest of our lives?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s the tyre.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I am getting too old for this crud.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Amy, I noticed your status still says in a relationship on Facebook.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’re right. I should probably let all of my Facebook friends know. Penny, I’m no longer in a relationship.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Did you change yours to married yet?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, no, not yet. There’s still a few people I haven’t told personally.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, just my parents and my entire family.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I don’t want to hurt my dad. You know, he always wanted to dance with his daughter at her wedding.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What about your sister’s wedding?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: They started to, then her water broke. You know, if he finds out we eloped, it’s gonna break his heart.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How long do you think you can keep it from him?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, isn’t it gonna get worse the longer you wait?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, not necessarily. You know, Dad’s not getting any younger, so if I wait long enough, I’ll just tell him he walked me down the aisle and it was magical.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: When did you learn how to change a tyre?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Every self-respecting gentleman should know how in case he comes across a damsel in distress by the side of the road.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If I see one scorpion, I am getting on someone’s shoulders and never coming down.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And there’s your damsel.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wow, this one’s really stuck.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are you turning it the right way?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. I took the other four off and when I got to this one, I thought, you know, I’m in a rut, let’s shake things up.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Here, let me try. You’re right, it doesn’t turn the other way.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: There you go. You’re all done.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That wasn’t so bad. Nice. Boy, if my mom could see me now, she’d lock me in the sin closet.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That’s a joke, right?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Actually, the joke was on her. I could still see the TV through the slats.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m starting to see why you and your mom aren’t very close.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Bet she’d still tell her if she got married.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re not gonna let this go, are you?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, it’s kind of sad that they don’t know. I mean, they love Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Fine, you want me to call? I’ll call. Why am I so nervous?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s understandable. Amy was afraid to tell her mom she broke up with Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah? How did it go? Did she make you crawl into the breaking-up drawer?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Uh, well, actually, to be honest, I haven’t told her yet.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’ve been giving me a hard time and you haven’t even told your mom about Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m feeling a little dizzy from all the blood loss. I don’t know what you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Fine. I’m calling home, but when I’m done, you’re calling your mother.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Easy for you to say. You never had to watch 60 Minutes like this.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, Daddy.

utterance.speaker: Penny’s Dad
utterance.content: Hey, slugger. How’s my girl?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, good. Is Mom around?

utterance.speaker: Penny’s Dad
utterance.content: Ah, she took your brother out to celebrate. He just got his tenth one-month sober chip. Yeah, she’s gonna make him a little necklace.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll talk to her later. Uh, Dad, there’s something I need to tell you. Leonard and I got married.

utterance.speaker: Penny’s Dad
utterance.content: You did? When?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Last week. I’m sorry, I should’ve told you. It was a spur of the moment thing. I feel terrible. Please don’t be too disappointed.

utterance.speaker: Penny’s Dad
utterance.content: Are you happy?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Very. Leonard is so great.

utterance.speaker: Penny’s Dad
utterance.content: Well, then I’m happy for you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Aw, thank you, Daddy. That means so much.

utterance.speaker: Penny’s Dad
utterance.content: Well, I understand it’s hard to tell someone something if you think it’s gonna upset ’em.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It is. You’re the best dad ever.

utterance.speaker: Penny’s Dad
utterance.content: Yeah. Uh, hold that thought. I’ve been sitting on a little news myself.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, what is it?

utterance.speaker: Penny’s Dad
utterance.content: You know that rototiller I got for the tractor?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Penny’s Dad
utterance.content: Oh, you should see it. It is a beautiful piece of machinery. Anyway, uh, I backed over your pet pig with it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Moondance?

utterance.speaker: Penny’s Dad
utterance.content: Yeah, he’s, uh, not dancing anymore.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You killed my pig?

utterance.speaker: Penny’s Dad
utterance.content: I did not kill him. The vet took care of that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: When?

utterance.speaker: Penny’s Dad
utterance.content: Oh, ten, twelve months ago.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You didn’t tell me for a year?

utterance.speaker: Penny’s Dad
utterance.content: Well, apple doesn’t fall far from the tree, does it? Love ya, slugger. Gotta go.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay, Amy, your turn.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s called Lamaze breathing. It helps you push.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Great. He’s pushing with his uterus.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: There’s got to be a smarter way of removing it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, this is nothing more than a physics problem.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Right. Archimedes once said give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Of course. All we need is to find stuff to make a lever big enough to fix this.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Exactly. I’ll bet there’s something around here that could be a lever.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Let’s see, a lever, a lever.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Everybody hold on. Let’s take this problem one step at a time. First, we need to decide whether we’re calling it leever or lehver. And the sooner we decide it’s leever, the sooner we can roll up our sleeves, not slehves, and get to work.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re gonna be here foreever.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thanks a lot, guys.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What did we do?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Before I made that call, my pig was alive and happy and rolling around in the mud. Now he’s illegally buried in our backyard next to my great-grandmother.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Really? They didn’t eat him?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. He was a beloved member of the family.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: The breakfast meat family?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s not funny. You’re up. Call your mother.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, maybe later. Your pig dying made me sad. And a little hungry.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Phone, now.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay. Okay. Fine. Hi, Mom.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Try dialing.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You saw that, huh? Hi, Mom. How are you doing? Oh, good. How’s work? That’s nice. I’m fine. Hey, listen, I’ve been meaning to ask, how come Aunt Doe and Aunt Florence never got along?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, just give me that. Amy broke up with Sheldon, she got her ears pierced and she made us eat penis cookies. Hang on. She wants to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t think the lever’s working.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What makes you say that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There’s gotta be something else we could try.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: If this was Star Trek, we could use a phaser to blast it off.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, it’s too broad of a beam. You’d need something more precise, like Superman’s heat vision.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ooh, the Green Lantern’s ring could make a big green hand that unscrews it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: If you need a green hand, why not just use the Hulk?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, please, the Hulk would never get across the border with that temper.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Guys, excuse me, not that calling one of the Avengers isn’t a perfectly reasonable choice, but we’re scientists. Don’t you think we can figure this out using actual science?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, we could use science. But it’s your bachelor party. Lighten up.

utterance.speaker: Caption
utterance.content: Scientific Principle: Percussive Shock.

utterance.speaker: Howard (singing)
utterance.content: We will, we will percussive shock you.

utterance.speaker: Howard and Raj (singing)
utterance.content: We will, we will percussive shock you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (singing)
utterance.content: Buddy you’re a boy, make a big noise playin’ in the street, gonna be a big man someday. You got mud on your face, you big disgrace, kickin’ your can all over the place. I have an eidetic memory. Sometimes it’s a curse.

utterance.speaker: Caption
utterance.content: Scientific Principle: Thermal Expansion.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I had no idea tortilla chips were such a good fuel source.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: They’re basically pure hydrocarbons soaked in fat. Let’s hope the lug nut expands.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What if that burning food attracts animals?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We have plenty of food for the animals.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We do?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yep. A six-foot wiener in a Flash T-shirt.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s not very nice.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s a bachelor party. Lighten up.

utterance.speaker: Caption
utterance.content: Scientific Principle: Accelerated Corrosion.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What is that awful smell?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s burning salsa. I’m hoping the acidity and salinity combined with electricity will corrode the lug nut off.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What an innovative solution. Perhaps I don’t give your MIT education enough credit.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, I saw it on Mythbusters.

utterance.speaker: Caption
utterance.content: Scientific Principle: Exothermic Reaction.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, this rust, combined with the aluminium recovered from the van, is now thermite.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Great. Couple of pinches ought to do the trick.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Is that enough to melt the lug nut?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, let’s start small. We can always add more.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You put up a good fight, lug nut, but you’ve met your match.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, look, the lug nut’s off.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What? What are you doing back?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We got a flat and couldn’t get the tyre off.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: If it makes you feel any better, I pierced Amy’s ears and her mom made her sit in my closet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We blew up Feynman’s van.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: My dad killed my pig with his tractor.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I spent the night in Mexico with Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You win.
